verses.roman:
punaḥ yadi kona kṣaṇa, kayāya kṛṣṇa daraśana
tabe sei ghaṭī-kṣaṇa-pala
diyā mālya-candana, nānā ratna-ābharaṇa,
alaṅkṛta karimu sakala

synonyms: punaḥ—again; yadi—if; kona—some; kṣaṇa—moment; kayāya—helps; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; daraśana—seeing; tabe—then; sei—that; ghaṭī-kṣaṇa-pala—seconds, moments and hours; diyā—offering; mālya-candana—garlands and sandalwood pulp; nānā—various; ratna—jewels; ābharaṇa—ornaments; alaṅkṛta—decorated; karimu—I shall make; sakala—all.
translation: "If by chance such a moment comes when I can once again see Kṛṣṇa, then I shall worship those seconds, moments and hours with flower garlands and pulp of sandalwood and decorate them with all kinds of jewels and ornaments."
